message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of 3D surface reconstruction from 2D images, which is a fundamental problem in computer vision. The proposed method focuses on preserving fine-scale details and sharp features while suppressing noise, which is a common challenge in computer graphics and computer vision. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes a novel inter-image similarity measure and a content-aware $\ell_p$-minimization algorithm, which are related to image processing and optimization, respectively. Therefore, cs.GR (Graphics) and cs.MM (Multimedia) are also likely categories. The paper also uses machine learning techniques to estimate the $p$ value and regularization parameters, which is related to cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper proposes a variational method, which is a common approach in optimization and numerical analysis, and therefore cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a possible category.
